About.name: Brunel University of London
About.about: Founded in 1966, Brunel University of London is a leading technology university renowned for its education and research and its spirit of innovation and entrepreneurship. It is based on a single leafy campus with outstanding sports facilities, easy access to central London and a friendly, vibrant and strikingly international community. Brunel provides its students with the academic knowledge and personal skills they need to forge successful and rewarding careers. Students will learn from academics who are leaders in their field and they can combine rigorous academic study with opportunities to apply their knowledge to real‑world issues. All students are encouraged to undertake a work placement and to explore areas of special interest through project work. Brunel aims to provide an exciting, challenging, inspiring and rewarding experience that will help to shape the future careers of our graduates.
About.whatMakesUsDifferent:
Unusually for a London university, Brunel is a single-site university with everything students need on one campus. Brunel guarantees accommodation on campus for all new students who meet their course conditions and apply for a room by 31 August 2025.  The campus is about 20 minutes’ walk from Uxbridge tube station, with central London 40 minutes away. Nearby West Drayton station on the Elizabeth line is a short bus ride away and students can reach Heathrow airport in 20 minutes by car.
Brunel has a long and distinguished history in sport, offering some of the best university sports facilities in the UK. These facilities are used by some of the world’s top athletes, including former 100m World Champion Yohan Blake and the ‘Linford Christie Academy’ sprinters.
Graduate employability is very important to Brunel. The University was one of the first universities in the UK to offer sandwich degrees and currently, over 95%  of its courses offer a placement.

Stats.heading: Stats
Stats.description: Statistics and reviews are supplied by trusted partners and are independent to UCAS. You should also consider attending an open day and talking to staff and students.

StudentLife.heading: Student life
studentLifeParagraphs: Brunel students have access to a wide range of learning facilities including the library, quiet study areas and computer labs. The Library is at the heart of the campus, holding a collection of approximately 400,000 books and an increasing collection of e-resources to support students’ study needs.  Students have access to wi-fi across campus and in halls of residence, Microsoft Office, 24-hour PC labs and a network email account.

The dedicated Student Centre offers financial, personal and academic support.  As part of the Student Centre, The Academic Skills service (ASK)  specialises in teaching all Brunel students the skills needed to learn independently and thrive academically, whatever their level or subject.

Support for students’ welfare is offered by the Student Wellbeing team, which works with many students including those with specific learning difficulties such as dyslexia, mental health difficulties such as anxiety, and other medical conditions.

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in London?Check out our region guide
paragraphs: There are 32 boroughs in Greater London, stretching from the City of London and Westminster, to surrounding areas like Chelsea, Camden, Richmond, Hackney and Islington.
It’s big, but it’s easy to jump on a train, tube or bus to experience everything on offer – from food pop-ups to world famous music acts, free museums and West End shows.
Fantastically diverse and historical, with many industries and businesses based here to kickstart your career, London is one of the most desirable – if pricey – cities in the world.

regionGuides.heading: What's it like to live in London?Check out our city guide
paragraphs: Discover what it’s really like to live in London as a student, including information on finding accommodation, cost of living and budgeting, and student life.

campusParagraphs: Brunel has a friendly, buzzing and exciting campus, with plenty of places to grab a coffee and hang out with friends. Students have a huge choice of food outlets offering dishes from all over world: traditional English, a variety of street food from pop-up vendors, pizza, Subway, Mexican food or flavours of the Middle East. There are green spaces to relax in and students love hanging out with friends in the quad, playing volleyball, listening to music or just enjoying the sun.  There are plenty of quiet places to sit or to walk and a pretty river runs through the centre of campus. Students don’t have to leave campus to stock up on essentials as there is a supermarket, regular pop-up market stalls and a pharmacy. Night-time entertainment includes the student bar Loco’s where students can grab some food and drinks with friends, watch the football or even try karaoke! The Venue nightclub offers something for everyone, from Juicy Wednesday's to Bollywood, Afrobashment and Live Music.

courseLocations.title: Brunel University London
courseLocations.address: Kingston Lane, Uxbridge, Middlesex, Uxbridge, UB8 3PH

Courses.heading: Courses
paragraphs: You can choose from courses in Business, Arts and Social Sciences; Engineering, Design and Physical Sciences; Health, Medicine and Life Sciences.
We offer the following first degrees:
• Bachelor of Engineering BEng
• Bachelor of Science BSc
• Bachelor of Arts BA
• Bachelor of Music BMus
• Bachelor of Laws LLB
• Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery MBBS
We also offer the following integrated master’s degrees:
• Master of Design MDes
• Master of Engineering MEng
• Master of Mathematics MMath
• Master of Science MSci
If you do not meet the standard criteria for year 1 entry you can choose a course with an integrated foundation year:
• Mathematics and Computing with an Integrated Foundation Year
• Engineering with an Integrated Foundation Year
• Economics and Mathematics with an Integrated Foundation Year
Brunel Pathway College also offers Foundation courses in a range of other subjects for students who do not meet the entry criteria.

Apprenticeships.heading: Apprenticeships
paragraphs: Apprenticeships are a fantastic way to gain a degree whilst pursuing a career that you are passionate about.

Our apprenticeship programmes are developed by employers, professional bodies and the University. As an apprentice you will be employed throughout the programme, spending part of your time at Brunel and the rest with your employer.
You will gain a full degree at either bachelor's or master's level – without needing to pay any student fees.
We offer the following apprenticeships:
Further information is available at: Brunel.ac.uk/higher-and-degree-apprenticeships

International.heading: International
paragraphs: We are proud to be home to over 8,800 talented students from around the world. We are ranked the most international university in the UK (Times Higher Education World University rankings 2025), and 38th in the UK in the 2025 QS World rankings. You can meet our international team at many events we attend throughout the world, and they will offer advice and help you through the application process. There are over 300 international scholarships up for grabs each year. Some are worth up to £6,000, which can really help with your tuition fees and living costs while you’re at university.

Brunel is based in west London so you can enjoy the London experience without the stresses and expense of being in central London. By choosing to study with us you’ll enjoy the best of city life, whilst being able to experience the beautiful English countryside. Accommodation is guaranteed for our international students, and our modern, safe rooms are just a short walk away from your lectures, library, medical centre, and multi-faith prayer rooms, as well as cafés, bars and a mini-supermarket.

Activities and social events are at the heart of campus life. There are 39 different international societies, 20 different academic societies and an exciting calendar of on-campus activities. We are just 45 minutes by underground to central London, a 20-minute walk to Uxbridge town centre and only 15 minutes by car to nearby Heathrow Airport. You can also explore nearby Uxbridge. Just a short walk or bus ride from our campus, you’ll find a variety of shops, cafés, and restaurants, offering something for everyone.

London is on your doorstep. There's so much to see and do in the city - you can explore iconic landmarks like the London Eye, Tower Bridge, and Buckingham Palace, vibrant art galleries and museums, or immerse yourself in the excitement of a West End theatre production. Plus, London offers plenty of opportunities for budget-friendly exploration, with free museums and concerts available. You can also take advantage of student deals and discounts on a variety of activities to stretch your budget further.

When you join Brunel, you’ll soon find your home in our warm and welcoming community. We have dedicated pre-departure events, as well as visa and immigration advice to make sure you are ready to start your journey with us. Our friendly Student Support team is on hand from the moment you arrive with international welcome events before you start your classes. You’ll meet new people and get practical advice about living in the UK. We’ll help you with things like opening a bank account and registering with a doctor (at our medical centre on campus if you wish). We also offer free academic English support during your degree if English isn’t your first language. We will give you ongoing support to make sure you have the best experience possible.

StudentSupport.heading: Student support
paragraphs: Brunel University of London offers a variety of support services to students.While students are with us, there may be times when they need some extra advice or support. Whether the help they need relates to student life, finances or studying, Brunel is ready to lend a hand. The support is available through one point of access so that students can identify which service is best for their individual needs.

Health servicesBrunel has a medical centre on campus which is open from 8am to 6.30pm Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday, with extended opening hours to 8.30pm on Wednesdays. There is also a pharmacy next door where students can pick up prescriptions.

Disability supportThe University's campus and facilities are recognised as some of the best in the country for disabled students. Brunel offers advice and support to students with a range of abilities, including those with dyslexia and other specific learning disabilities, Asperger syndrome, mobility and sensory impairments and unseen disabilities such as epilepsy, diabetes, arthritis and sickle cell anaemia. There is a range of facilities and equipment, some of which is available for students to loan, and an Assistive Technology Centre which has software that can help students study. Disability advisers arrange support individually with each student and the service is confidential.
Counselling and mental wellbeingBrunel is committed to supporting students' mental health and wellbeing – offering a variety of services which are free to all Brunel students.

Financial supportThe Student Centre helps students with financial concerns. They can book an appointment with the Welfare Team who can advise them of the support available. These sessions are free and confidential.

Academic skillsThe Academic Skills team (ASK) provides a welcoming and inclusive environment, offering guidance in writing and learning, as well as in maths and statistics. They help students develop academic and research skills, as well as how to study more effectively and independently, for life-long learning.

Brunel Language CentreFor students whose first language isn’t English, Brunel Language Centre offers additional support through individual academic consultations, group classes and workshops. Areas covered include academic writing (eg technical reports, critiques, proposals and dissertations), seminar skills, presentations, reading and listening skills, pronunciation and grammar.

Faith and religionStudents can unwind and explore faith and spirituality at appropriate prayer facilities around campus. The Meeting House is a dedicated space where students can enjoy the Quiet Room or relax with tea in the lounge. Chaplains from Christian and Muslim faiths are available throughout the week.

Keeping students safeBrunel helps keep students safe 24 hours a day, seven days a week throughout the whole year, both on and off-campus. They provide campus security, parking enforcement and crime prevention. All security staff are trained First Responders and accredited by the London Ambulance Service as well as being trained in mental health first aid, so they can provide pastoral care and welfare support. They can also advise students about crime prevention.
